docs.lead_paragraph: The new running mate of Gov. George E. Pataki is opposed to Medicaid financing for abortions, an aide said today. Governor Pataki struggled in the 1994 election to convince women that he supported abortion rights. Eileen Long, a campaign spokeswoman for Pataki's running mate, Mary O. Donohue, a former state judge, said, ''She is personally opposed to Medicaid funding.'' Ms. Donohue was not available today to talk about her position.

headline.main: Abortion Financing Separates Pataki And Running Mate

docs.abstract: Eileen Long, campaign spokeswoman for Gov George E Pataki's running mate, Mary O Donohue, says Donohue is opposed to Medicaid financing for abortions; Zenia Mucha, Pataki's spokeswoman, says he favors Medicaid financing and considers himself abortion rights supporter (M)
